isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Driver Controlled Main Differential Lock - Removing the Differential and Gear Assembly and Main Differential Lock

svcproc.title: Removing the Differential and Gear Assembly and Main Differential Lock

step1.para: To remove the differential lock sliding shift collar, tap out the two retainer roll pins until they are level with the inner face of the shift fork ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Tap Out Two Retainer Roll Pins

step1.para: If required, remove the differential lock shift unit.

step2.para: Remove the sensor switch and jam nut.
Remove the four bolts and washers that hold the cylinder cover. Remove the cover and, on the 160 series, the copper gasket ( Figure 169).
Remove the shift cylinder and piston.

note.para: It may be necessary to use heat to separate the shaft from the fork to loosen the Loctite.

step2.para: Remove the shift shaft from the shift fork.
Remove the shift shaft spring and flat washer.

note.para: Some models use silastic seal instead of the flat washer in Step E. Also, a roll pin is installed in the shift shaft and is used as a stop for the shift shaft spring. It is not necessary to remove this roll pin during a normal disassembly.

step2.para: Remove the shift fork and continue with Step 10.

figure.caption: Figure 169. Remove Bolts, Washers, and Cylinder Cover

svcsubproc.title: Threaded Type Shift Assembly
svcsubproc.para: The current design shift fork does not employ roll pins. Nubs on the inner face of the fork hold the shift collar in place ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Nubs Hold Shift Collar in Place

note.para: Before continuing, make sure the differential lock is released and the engaging bolt and seal are removed from the shift cylinder.

step1.para: Tap the shift collar with a rubber mallet to loosen and remove the collar from the shift fork ( Figure 171).
Remove the differential lock sensor switch and jam nut from the shift tower of the carrier ( Figure 172).

figure.caption: Figure 172. Remove Differential Lock Sensor Switch and Jam Nut

step1.para: Remove the shift cylinder and piston assembly from the shift tower of the carrier by turning it to the left ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 173. Remove Shift Cylinder and Piston Assembly

step1.para: Put the shift cylinder and piston assembly in a vise that has brass covers over the jaws. Remove the piston and O-ring from inside the cylinder. Use a narrow drift through the hole in the top of the cylinder to push out the piston. It may be necessary to use a mallet to tap out the piston ( Figure 174).
Carefully remove the O-ring from the piston. Use a thin pointed tool to remove the O-ring, taking care not to damage the piston ( Figure 175).
Inspect the O-ring for any damage such as cracks, cuts or breaks. If the O-ring is damaged, replace it with a new O-ring when you assemble the components.
Clean and inspect all shift assembly parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.
Pull the shift shaft from the fork and out of the carrier ( Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Pull Shift Shaft From Fork

step1.para: Remove the shift shaft spring and fork from inside the shift tower of the carrier ( Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Remove Shift Shaft Spring and Fork

step1.para: If lock pins are used, use a hammer and a brass drift to remove the lock pins for the adjusting rings on the bearing caps.
If cotter pins are used, remove the cotter pins.
Remove the bearing caps, bolts and washers, the bearing caps and the adjusting rings. Match mark one bearing cap and one carrier leg so that these parts will be assembled in the correct positions.
Lift the differential and gear assembly from the carrier ( Figure 178).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Lift Differential and Gear Assembly From Carrier

step1.para: Further disassembly of these carriers is the same as axles without the driver controlled main differential lock. To continue disassembly, follow the procedures starting with Step 8 under DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM THE AXLE HOUSING.
CLEAN AND INSPECT, ASSEMBLE, and INSTALL are also the same for both axles.
